intro: Guichenotia basivirida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Guichenotia basivirida is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
